content: What popular kitchen appliance, invented by Percy Spencer in the 1940s, was originally called a "Radarange"?

That would be the microwave oven. Percy Spencer, an American engineer, is indeed credited with inventing it in the 1940s. The first commercially available microwave oven was called the "Radarange," and it was quite large, about the size of a refrigerator. It's fascinating how technology has evolved, isn't it? Now, microwaves are a standard fixture in kitchens around the world, and they've become much more compact and efficient. I wonder what other inventions from that era have transformed our daily lives in such significant ways.
